alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 3:45PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WARMUP ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN INTERIOR THIS WEEK... With colder temperatures that made a recent return across the region over the last several days, a major pattern shift will take place beginning Monday as strong high pressure begins to build. High temperatures will climb into the 40s Monday, and then into the upper 40s to near 50 Tuesday and again Wednesday, primarily south of the Yukon River. With a gradual cool down Thursday and Friday, with highs falling into the 30s to near 40. This should start to initiate the snowmelt process during the day, causing substantial areas of ponding on roadways and near building in and around Fairbanks. Temperatures will cool overnight, with lows dipping into the single digits to 10s above zero, halting the melting process during the overnight hours and causing any ponding to refreeze.
